We also know that currently, only 4/5 (or 80%) of the flowers have bloomed. This means that out of every 20 flowers, 16 (i.e., 80% of 20) have bloomed. That leaves behind 4 unbloomed flowers per row. So we can calculate the number of bloomed flowers as follows:

1462640400 flowers
80% blooming rate per flower
= 1462640400 * 0.8
= 1170112320 flowers

The answer is: 1170112320.
